questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

You configured an IPsec tunnel to a branch office. Now you want to make sure that the encryption of the tunnel is offloaded to hardware.
Referring to the exhibit, which statement is true?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B indeed. explanation is already added

Selected Answer: B
npu_flag=00 Means that ingress & egress ESP packets are not offloaded
npu_flag=01 Means only egress ESP packets can be offloaded, ingress ESP packets will be handled by the kernel
npu_flag=02 Means only ingress ESP packets can be offloaded, egress ESP packets will be handled by the kernel
npu_flag=03 Means that both ingress & egress ESP packets will be offloaded

choices.C: Incoming and outgoing traffic is offloaded.
choices.B: Outgoing traffic is offloaded; incoming traffic not offloaded.
choices.A: Outgoing traffic is offloaded; you cannot determine if incoming traffic is offloaded at this time.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

You have installed a FortiSandbox and configured it in your FortiMail.
Referring to the exhibit, which two statements are correct? (Choose two.)

choices.D: FortiMail will wait up to 30 minutes to obtain the scan results.
choices.B: FortiMail will cache the results for 30 minutes
choices.C: If the FortiSandbox with IP 10.10.10.3 is not available, the e-mail will be checked by the FortiCloud Sandbox.
choices.A: If FortiMail is not able to obtain the results from the FortiGuard queries, URIs will not be checked by the FortiSandbox.

questions.question_text:
A FortiGate with the default configuration shown below is deployed between two IP telephones. FortiGate receives the INVITE request shown in the exhibit from
Phone A (internal) to Phone B (external).
NVITE sip:PhoneB@172.20.120.30 SIP/2.0
Via: SIP/2.0/UDP 10.31.101.20:5060
From: PhoneA <sip:PhoneA@10.31.101.20>
To: PhoneB <sip:PhoneB@172.20.120.30>

Call-ID: 314159@10.31.101.20 -

CSeq: 1 INVITE -
Contact: sip:PhoneA@10.31.101.20
v=0
o=PhoneA 5462346 332134 IN IP4 10.31.101.20
c=IN IP4 10.31.101.20
m=audio 49170 RTP 0 3
Which two statements are correct after the FortiGate receives the packet? (Choose two.)

choices.B: A pinhole will be opened to accept traffic sent to the FortiGate WAN IP address.
choices.D: A pinhole is not required to accept traffic sent to the FortiGate WAN IP address.
choices.A: NAT takes place only in the SIP application layer.
choices.C: NAT takes place at both the network and SIP application layers.

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

You have two data centers with a FortiGate 7000-series chassis connected by VPN. All traffic flows over an established generic routing encapsulation (GRE) tunnel between them. You are troubleshooting traffic that is traversing between Server VLAN A and Server VLAN B. The performance is lower than expected and you notice all traffic is only going through the FPM in slot 3 while nothing through the FPM in slot 4.
Referring to the exhibit, which statement is true?

choices.A: Removing traffic shaping from the firewall policy allowing this traffic will allow for load-balancing to the other module.
choices.B: Changing the algorithm to take source IP, destination IP and port into account will load balance this traffic to the other module.
choices.C: There is no way to load-balance the traffic in this scenario.
choices.D: Configuring a load-balance flow-rule in the CLI will load-balance this traffic.

choices.B: OSPF requires the redistribution of connected networks.
choices.A: FG2 is within the wrong OSPF area.
choices.C: There is an OSPF interface network-type mismatch.
choices.D: A prefix for the default route is missing.

discussion.content: network type broadcast, supposed to have a DR/BDR/DRother status shown.
